title.narrative: 4.2 PUBLIC FINANCIAL FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2023, the governmental authorities obtain detailed analytical information on the social sectors financingUNDAF/Produit 6.2 : D'ici 2023, les autoritÃ©s disposent d'information analytique dÃ©taillÃ©e sur le financement des secteurs sociaux., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Evaluation, Private Sector Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most vulnerable families, children and adolescents (boys and girls) benefit from a gradual increase in social protection coverage, equity of access to basic social services in their communities and opportunities for empowerment and development

title.narrative: By 2023, the governmental authorities obtain detailed analytical information on the social sectors financingUNDAF/Produit 6.2 :D?ici 2023, les autorites disposent d?information analytique detaillee sur le financement des secteurs sociaux.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support capacity building of the Social Budget Monitoring Observatory members and expanded its partnership with Members of Parliament for an effective advocacy to fund of child-sensitive programs. With particular reference to financing of social protection, a technical dialogue was initiated with the Government and the International Monetary Fund to establish a mechanism of public spending.Beside this, UNICEF has initiated a review of public spending in social protection and an analysis of transparency and budget credibility in the fields of immunization and WASH. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
